text.section:
If the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation is receiver of a banking institution, the Corporation may:
Operate the trust department of the institution; and
Liquidate the institution as provided in this subtitle or under federal law.

section.section: This subsection applies whether or not the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation is the receiver of the banking institution.

If the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation pays the insured deposit liabilities of a banking institution, it is subrogated to the rights of the depositors against the institution to the same extent as it would be subrogated to the rights of the depositors against a closed national banking association under federal law.
The rights of the depositors and creditors of the banking institution are governed by the laws of this State.
